events.message: Customer reported a car accident involving a rear-end collision at a traffic light around 8:00 AM.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and vehicle details.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim to provide personalized support.
Customer received confirmation that their accident claim has been acknowledged and is under review.
Requested the customer to submit police report, photos of damages, and vehicle registration for claim processing.
Customer provided all requested documents including detailed photos and official police report for further assessment.
Investigation team began reviewing submitted evidence and contacting involved parties to verify claim details.
Completed investigation confirming liability and assessing the damage amount for accurate claim settlement.
The company proposed a fair settlement amount to cover all repair costs associated with the auto accident.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the timely communication throughout process.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance company, allowing the payment process to begin.
Payment for the approved claim was successfully issued to the customer's bank account without delays.
The claim file was closed after confirming that the customer received payment and no further issues remain.
All claim documents and records were archived securely for future reference and compliance purposes.
